subject: broken connector
description_text:
hello, i broke the connector on the break pedal and am trying to fix it, is
it an RJ11 4 pin connector?

conversations.body_text: Hi Spencer Stencel,  ​The brake RJ connector can be taken to a nearby computer repair shop. You can simply re-crimp a new connector following the throttle wiring sequence. It is indeed an RJ11 4P4C connector.

Hi thank you, I am capable of doing this my self as I am a low voltage and
pc technician and work in IT

On Sun, Nov 30, 2025, 10:26 PM support@simsonn.com

what is the exact specifications of the RJ11 plug used? i ordered some and
they are 4 pin but too big to fit into the hub


On Sun, Nov 30, 2025 at 10:52 PM Spencer Stencel <stencel237@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Hi thank you, I am capable of doing this my self as I am a low voltage and
> pc technician and work in IT
>
> On Sun, Nov 30, 2025, 10:26 PM support@simsonn.com
Hi Spencer Stencel,     This is what I found on Amazon; it is the model you purchased.
